text: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

text: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

text: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: To be is to be perceived.
author: George Berkeley

text: Man is condemned to be free.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: One cannot step twice in the same river.
author: Heraclitus

text: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

text: Happiness is the highest good.
author: Aristotle

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence is not an act but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The life of man is of no greater importance to the universe than that of an oyster.
author: David Hume

text: Liberty consists in doing what one desires.
author: John Stuart Mill

text: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

text: Science is what you know. Philosophy is what you don't know.
author: Bertrand Russell

text: The only thing I know is that I know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.
author: African Proverb

text: I am not African because I was born in Africa but because Africa was born in me.
author: Kwame Nkrumah

text: Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I am the master of my fate, I am the captain of my soul.
author: William Ernest Henley

text: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: African Proverb

text: Until the lion learns to write, every story will glorify the hunter.
author: African Proverb

text: A people without the knowledge of their past history is like a tree without roots.
author: Marcus Garvey

text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: We must use time wisely and forever realize that the time is always ripe to do right.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: I speak not for myself but for those without voice.
author: Malala Yousafzai

text: The soul that is within me no man can degrade.
author: Frederick Douglass

text: Africa is not poor. Africa is poorly managed.
author: Thomas Sankara

text: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: When the roots are deep, there is no reason to fear the wind.
author: African Proverb

text: He who learns, teaches.
author: Ethiopian Proverb

text: No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
author: African Proverb

text: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children.
author: African Proverb

text: The youth of a nation are the trustees of posterity.
author: Patrice Lumumba

text: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

text: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

text: Move fast and break things.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

text: It's not a bug, it's a feature.
author: Anonymous

text: The most dangerous phrase in the language is: We've always done it this way.
author: Grace Hopper

text: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice, there is.
author: Yogi Berra

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it's bad.
author: Cory House

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: The advance of technology is based on making it fit in so that you don't really even notice it.
author: Bill Gates

text: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: To be, or not to be, that is the question.
author: William Shakespeare

text: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of a wife.
author: Jane Austen

text: All that is gold does not glitter, not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: It was the best of times, it was the worst of times.
author: Charles Dickens

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: So it goes.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

text: One must imagine Sisyphus happy.
author: Albert Camus

text: All animals are equal, but some animals are more equal than others.
author: George Orwell

text: The only people for me are the mad ones.
author: Jack Kerouac

text: Who controls the past controls the future. Who controls the present controls the past.
author: George Orwell

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Call me Ishmael.
author: Herman Melville

text: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky

text: Beware; for I am fearless, and therefore powerful.
author: Mary Shelley

text: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, many are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live.
author: J.K. Rowling

text: Whatever you are, be a good one.
author: Abraham Lincoln

text: A reader lives a thousand lives before he dies.
author: George R.R. Martin

text: The wound is the place where the light enters you.
author: Rumi

text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

text: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

text: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: Your limitation—it's only your imagination.
author: Anonymous

text: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Anonymous

text: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Anonymous

text: Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
author: Anonymous

text: Success doesn't just find you. You have to go out and get it.
author: Anonymous

text: Don't stop when you're tired. Stop when you're done.
author: Anonymous

text: Wake up with determination. Go to bed with satisfaction.
author: Anonymous

text: Little things make big days.
author: Anonymous

text: It's going to be hard, but hard does not mean impossible.
author: Anonymous

text: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
author: Anonymous

text: Don't limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Anonymous

text: Every champion was once a contender that refused to give up.
author: Rocky Balboa

text: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

text: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

text: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: L'enfer, c'est les autres.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: Je pense, donc je suis.
author: René Descartes

text: Le cœur a ses raisons que la raison ne connaît point.
author: Blaise Pascal

text: Il faut imaginer Sisyphe heureux.
author: Albert Camus

text: On ne voit bien qu'avec le cœur. L'essentiel est invisible pour les yeux.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: La liberté des uns s'arrête là où commence celle des autres.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: L'homme est né libre, et partout il est dans les fers.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: Le savoir est la seule matière qui s'accroît quand on la partage.
author: Socrate

text: Il n'y a qu'un héroïsme au monde : c'est de voir le monde tel qu'il est et de l'aimer.
author: Romain Rolland

text: L'imagination est plus importante que le savoir.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Rien ne se perd, rien ne se crée, tout se transforme.
author: Antoine Lavoisier

text: La culture, c'est ce qui reste quand on a tout oublié.
author: Édouard Herriot

text: Le génie est une longue patience.
author: Gustave Flaubert

text: Chaque homme doit inventer son chemin.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

text: Qui veut voyager loin ménage sa monture.
author: Jean Racine

text: Il faut cultiver notre jardin.
author: Voltaire

text: La vie est un sommeil, l'amour en est le rêve.
author: Alfred de Musset

text: Le doute est le commencement de la sagesse.
author: Aristote

text: Connais-toi toi-même.
author: Socrate

text: Ce qui ne me tue pas me rend plus fort.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: La vraie générosité envers l'avenir consiste à tout donner au présent.
author: Albert Camus

text: L'absurde naît de la confrontation de l'appel humain avec le silence déraisonnable du monde.
author: Albert Camus

text: Tout ce que je sais, c'est que je ne sais rien.
author: Socrate

text: Aimer, ce n'est pas se regarder l'un l'autre, c'est regarder ensemble dans la même direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

text: La simplicité est la sophistication suprême.
author: Léonard de Vinci

text: L'éducation est l'arme la plus puissante pour changer le monde.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Là où il y a une volonté, il y a un chemin.
author: Proverbe

text: Le succès, c'est tomber sept fois et se relever huit.
author: Proverbe japonais

text: Chaque accomplissement commence par la décision d'essayer.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: L'avenir appartient à ceux qui croient en la beauté de leurs rêves.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: La patience est amère, mais son fruit est doux.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

text: Vivre, c'est la chose la plus rare au monde. La plupart des gens ne font qu'exister.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Un peuple qui oublie son passé se condamne à le revivre.
author: Winston Churchill

text: Technology is best when it brings people together.
author: Matt Mullenweg

text: The Web as I envisaged it, we have not seen it yet.
author: Tim Berners-Lee

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: The impediment to action advances action. What stands in the way becomes the way.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: You have power over your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

text: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Stay afraid, but do it anyway.
author: Carrie Fisher

text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

text: Those who dare to fail miserably can achieve greatly.
author: John F. Kennedy

text: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anaïs Nin

text: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: What you do speaks so loudly that I cannot hear what you say.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The pen is mightier than the sword.
author: Edward Bulwer-Lytton

text: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people just exist.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
author: Lao Tzu

text: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.
author: Seneca

text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
author: Jimi Hendrix

text: What we know is a drop, what we don't know is an ocean.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Try not. Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

text: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right.
author: Henry Ford

text: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: The time is always right to do what is right.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Intelligence plus character—that is the goal of true education.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

text: Software is eating the world.
author: Marc Andreessen

text: Privacy is not something that I'm merely entitled to, it's an absolute prerequisite.
author: Marlon Brando

text: The Internet is becoming the town square for the global village of tomorrow.
author: Bill Gates

text: Artificial intelligence is the new electricity.
author: Andrew Ng

text: Data is the new oil.
author: Clive Humby

text: On ne naît pas femme, on le devient.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

text: La vie sans musique est tout simplement une erreur.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

text: Être ou ne pas être, telle est la question.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Le bonheur est parfois caché dans l'inconnu.
author: Victor Hugo

text: Il n'y a pas de hasard, il n'y a que des rendez-vous.
author: Paul Éluard

text: La plus grande aventure est celle qui nous attend.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Ce n'est pas parce que les choses sont difficiles que nous n'osons pas, c'est parce que nous n'osons pas qu'elles sont difficiles.
author: Sénèque

text: Impossible n'est pas français.
author: Napoléon Bonaparte

text: Le monde appartient à ceux qui se lèvent tôt.
author: Proverbe français

text: Qui vivra verra.
author: Proverbe français

text: When spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
author: Ethiopian Proverb

text: However long the night, the dawn will break.
author: African Proverb

text: Wisdom is like a baobab tree; no one individual can embrace it.
author: African Proverb

text: A bird that flies off the earth and lands on an anthill is still on the ground.
author: Igbo Proverb

text: Knowledge without wisdom is like water in the sand.
author: Guinean Proverb

text: Only a fool tests the depth of a river with both feet.
author: African Proverb

text: The axe forgets, but the tree remembers.
author: African Proverb

text: Rain does not fall on one roof alone.
author: Cameroonian Proverb

text: A wise person will always find a way.
author: Tanzanian Proverb

text: Return to old watering holes for more than water; friends and dreams are there to meet you.
author: African Proverb

text: Tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.
author: African Proverb

text: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

text: What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: There is nothing outside of yourself that can ever enable you to get better, stronger, richer, quicker, or smarter. Everything is within.
author: Miyamoto Musashi
